12222222121111.content:
Your eyes closed before feeling her horn lightly touched yours. But then images slowly start to show up. First was when a young colt was born, pelt black as the night, mane and tail as white as snow. No horn as unicorns start growing their horns when they reach adolescence. The next was the day he first met her when she was but a filly, both of them becoming fast friends. Fast forward to his first rut, claiming her before any other stallion could. The next was seeing her belly swell with the foals he put in her.

You suddenly stumbled back, breaking the connection as your mind still processes what it just saw. "I-I remember. Aleu."

"How do you know my name?"

"I remember, I was your mate. I remember the day I died. We were fleeing from the other humans, your pregnancy was weighing you down. You yelled for me to leave you behind as you was only slowing us down. I refused and took an arrow that was meant for you. While they were harvesting my body, it allowed you time to escape."

"Michala... I thought I would never see you again!" Her eyes became cloudy with tears as she nuzzled you, you hugged her back as your body started to swell out, your shirt tearing at the strain.

"Aleu, there's something I need to know." A slight pause. "Our foals, did you deliver them safely?"

I asked "What are their names?" "The girl is named Charlotte, and the boy is named Sheamus." I tried my best not to scream to the heavens but it was a very close call. I can't wait to finally meet them. I bet we are gonna have a few problems here and there since this will be the first time me and the Foals ever met, but I bet it's gonna go well don't you Aleu?" "I so agree, I just don't think we're gonna see them today. It's starting to get dark. We should turn in. They are living with me in a cave near the mountain." So that night we slept while I was mumbling in my sleep that "I can't believe that I was finally gonna meet my two Foals tomorrow." While we slept I was transforming more and more. First I lost my hair color because my Mane and Tail were turning white while my skin was getting darker and darker. The night was so still that you could even hear a ladybug land on a leaf. Then the morning came and as we woke up Aleu and I could tell the transformation has finished. "So, are you ready to finally meet the Foals?" "You know it sweetie, this will probably be the best day ever." "I agree, even though you never got the chance to see them, you should see how much they grew in the last few centuries." "I also can't wait but I have a question. Over the course you had with them are they teenagers or full grown Unicorns?" "well from the last time I saw them (Which ironically was just yesterday) they were late teens early adult unicorns. They're horns have fully grown and they are very impressive whith their magic. They learned just as fast as you did when you were just a Foal." "WOW! Well at least it's good to know that some of my traits were inherited by the Foals." "I agree now we better get some breakfast and head on to the cave before we lose anymore time." "Your right Aleu after last night with all that transformation and excitement happening I'm famished." So they ate some berries off of the bush's and went on their way to the cave. When they got to the cave they found Charlotte and Sheamus playing tag with their magic. "Got you Charlotte." Said Sheamus "No way you missed me by a mile." "Hey, I got you and you know it." "I don't think s- hey look mom's back and she brought someone with her." As they were running to their parents they were amazed when they saw their dad (when they became teenagers they kept asking where's dad 24/7 so Aleu had no choice but to tell them. They were upset about the news but they learned that their father is in their hearts.) "Dad, is that really you?" Asked Charlotte "Yes Charlotte it's me. I was reincarnated as a human but your mom realized that my place is to be with all of you as a family." Charlotte and Sheamus were crying their hearts out while they were hugging their dad. It was so emotional that the dad and Aleu cried as well. Then they all came together in a HUGE family hug. When they finally stopped crying they went in the cave while their dad told them about all the adventures he had (Except the part with how Aleu and him reunited because that would plant weird images in their heads.).

You hear the unicorn's sweet voice within your head, telling you to relax, to sleep. To be digested.

And the most frightening part is, you feel a compulsion to obey.

Somewhere in the back of your mind you know you are under her enchantment, and that same part of your mind struggles against it.. but only briefly.

The gently put, but relentless suggestion she has placed over your mind becomes increasingly tempting to obey. After all, she really is a beautiful creature. Would it really be so bad to feed her? To become part of her?

You shift around, trying to get comfortable within her stomach. Her belly is very tight, but it is also slick and eventually you struggle into a comfortable position.

On the outside, movement is clearly visible from the bulge of her snowy white belly.

Inside her belly it is very soft and warm. Sleep slowly reaches up and wraps it's feathery fingers around your mind, and you feel yourself beginning to drift. Before you do, you hear the unicorn give a soft belch.

(Thank you human. I was very hungry but thanks to you, I am feeling full now. I won't forget you.)

Your last thoughts before you drift off are how strange it is to be food. It's hard to imagine that a you can be food, even though you really are no different than any other animal. And to be food for a creature that is supposed to be a myth!

But, like any other creature, you can be and are food. Slowly, her belly breaks you down and begins to move you into the coils of her intestines to be absorbed.

After a day, the bulge in her tummy is completely gone. Her intestines do their work and soon you are simple nutrition ..
